section.title: Shell Account
section.para: Important Note: this feature can be deactivated by your CodeX site administrator and may therefore be unavailable in your organization.
If the CodeX administrators have enabled this feature, each registered user receives its own Unix shell account on the CodeX Shell Account server. You can access your CodeX Shell Account in 2 ways:

listitem.para: SSH: the secured remote shell is the preferred way to connect to the CodeX Shell Account server. SSH clients are available for all platforms (Windows, Linux, Unix and Mac) and allows a secure link with your personal directories. It also provides you with a number of other useful utilities like scp for remote file transfer. section.title: FTP Storage Spaces
section.para: Each project receives its own FTP storage which is made of 2 distinct zones. The Anonymous FTP Space and the File Release FTP space.

section.title: The Anonymous FTP Space
section.para: The anonymous FTP space can be used by the project members to upload any kind of documents or project data and deliverables they want. This storage will then be visible to any CodeX users and all files placed in this directory can be freely downloaded. So make sure that you use this storage space for world readable files only.

listitem.para: Anonymous Users access: use an ftp client to connect to &SYS_DOWNLOAD_HOST;. Use "ftp" as login and your email address as the password. Then cd /pub/projectname to access the FTP Anonymous space.

Project Members access: use an ftp client to connect to &SYS_DOWNLOAD_HOST;. Use CodeX login and password and then type cd /home/ftp/pub/projectname to access the FTP Anonymous space. From there project members have both read and write access which means that they can upload files.

section.title: The File Release FTP Space
section.para: This is where CodeX stores the new file releases uploaded and registered through the CodeX File Release service (see ). Access is granted to project members only in case they want to make modifications by hand. We highly recommend you do not touch this space since it is entirely managed through the CodeX Web interface. If you have questions about your file releases please contact the CodeX Team.
